alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 2:47PM PST until January 17 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...In Oregon, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Oregon. In Washington, Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Thursday to 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A brief lull in precipitation will occur tonight inbetween weather systems. The next system is expected to bring heavy snow in the morning and early afternoon, which will transition over the freezing rain and sleet by the later afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Columbia River Gorge of Washington
